Title: Android developer
Summary:
Job Summary

  • Experience Level:Mid level

Description:
Job Description/Requirements

We are looking for an experienced Android developer with tested experience in developing Native android applications. The job is a consultancy service that should be delivered in 30 days.

·        Strong Programming Skills: Proficiency in Java or Kotlin programming languages is essential for Android development. You should have a solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts and be able to write clean and efficient code.

·        Knowledge of Database Management: Understanding database concepts and experience working with databases like SQLite or MySQL is important for storing and retrieving user data, driver information, ride history, and other relevant data in the application.

·        User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) Design: A good understanding of UI/UX principles is essential for creating an intuitive and visually appealing app interface. Knowledge of XML or Android Layout files and designing responsive and interactive interfaces is beneficial.

 

Other pre-requisites

·        Minimum 2 years of experience developing Native android applications

·        Minimum Degree in IT related field from a reputable university

·        Must have done similar assignments in the last two years

·        Must have good problem-solving skills and a reputation of working with teams

·        Discipline to deliver the assignment within the stipulated time.

·        Interviews will be done on a rolling basis, earlier applicants will have first chance.

Title: Chief Operations Officer
Summary:
Job Summary

Degree/diploma in finance or accounting – some bookkeeping knowledge is essential to support with posting correcting journals

  • Experience Level:Executive level
  • Experience Length:8 years
Description:
Job Description/Requirements

Job Title: Chief Operations Officer.

Work Location: Nairobi, Kenya.

Terms: Full time


ABOUT THE ROLE.

The main overall duty of a COO is to assist the MD ensuring the smooth and efficient functioning of the INCREDO's operations, driving operational excellence, and contributing to the achievement of the company’s goals and objectives. Specific focus on HR Management to ensure that the company has the right talent, appropriate organizational structure, and enhance performance management in line with INCREDO’s strategic objectives.


WHAT YOU WILL DO

Operational Leadership: provide strategic and operational leadership to ensure smooth and efficient day-to-day operations of the MFI. To oversee various operational functions, including branch operations, loan processing, customer service, administration, and IT infrastructure. Ensure all systems operate smoothly and align with business set quality standards and target uptime.

Strategic Planning and Execution; To collaborates with the MD /CEO and other senior executives to develop and implement the MFI's strategic goals and objectives. Ability to translate the strategic vision into actionable plans and initiatives, ensuring alignment with the MFI's mission and business objectives.

Risk Management: responsible for identifying, assessing, and managing operational risks. Ddevelop and implements risk management strategies, policies, and procedures to mitigate risks associated with lending, operational processes, compliance, and reputation. Maximize the efficiency of all business standard operating procedures- SOP.

Process Improvement:  continuously evaluates operational processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization. implements process improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, productivity, and customer experience within the INCREDO. Establish line functional heads Key result Areas, as cascaded from annual corporate strategy and conduct quality assessments. 

Financial Management: works closely with the head of finance and finance team to ensure effective financial management and control within the company.  Monitors financial performance, analyse operational costs, and implement cost control measures to maximize profitability and operational efficiency. 

Team Management Responsible to provide leadership, mentorship, and guidance to build a high-performing and motivated team. Establish and monitor key staff performance and development goals, assign accountabilities, set objectives, establish priorities, and conduct annual performance appraisals.

Compliance and Regulatory Oversight: The COO ensures that the INCREDO operates in compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. Works closely with the risk and compliance team to develop and implement compliance programs, policies, and procedures to mitigate operational and regulatory risks.

Stakeholder Management: In liaison with the MD represents the INCREDO in various external stakeholder engagements, including regulatory bodies, industry associations, and partner organizations. They build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to promote the INCREDO's objectives and interests.

Technology and Innovation: The COO collaborates with the IT department to leverage technology and digital solutions to enhance operational processes, customer service, and efficiency within the MFI. They identify opportunities for technology adoption and innovation to drive operational excellence.


ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS.

 Bachelors in commerce, or Business Administration and other relevant undergraduate degree.

 A Master in business administration in ether strategy, operation, HR is an added advantage.


PROFFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS.

 At least one of the following: - Institute of Human Resource Management, Institute of Certified Accountant/ ACCA, Kenya institute of Management or Marketing society of Kenya.


ABOUT YOU.

• A minimum of 8 years’ experience, 3 years of which is in a C-suite position in a Financial institution or related industry.

• Industry Experience: Substantial experience in the microfinance industry or financial services sector is crucial. This includes hands-on experience in managing microfinance operations, understanding credit and lending practices, and familiarity with relevant regulations and compliance requirements.

• Leadership and Management Skills: should possess strong leadership and management skills to effectively oversee the operational functions of INCREDO. This includes experience as a team leader, setting strategic direction, managing performance, and driving operational excellence.

• Communication and Interpersonal Skills: The COO should have excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, including the MD /CEO, board members, staff, regulators, and external partners. Strong interpersonal skills are necessary for building relationships, resolving conflicts, and influencing others.

• Problem-Solving and Decision-Making: The COO should possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address operational challenges and make informed decisions. They should be able to analyze complex situations, evaluate options, and implement effective solutions.

• Strategic Thinking: The COO must have the ability to think strategically and contribute to the development and implementation of the INCREDO’s strategic plans. Should have a deep understanding of the industry landscape, market dynamics, and emerging trends to guide the operational strategy of the organization.

• Risk Management Expertise: Given the inherent risks in microfinance operations, the COO should have a strong background in overseeing risk management. This includes experience in identifying, assessing, and managing operational risks, developing risk management frameworks, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

• Financial Acumen: Proficiency in finance including a solid understanding of financial statements, budgeting, financial analysis, and cost control. Experience in financial planning, forecasting, and performance measurement is also valuable.

• Commitment to Social Impact: A COO in an MFI should have a genuine passion for the mission and social impact of microfinance. They should be committed to serving underserved populations, promoting financial inclusion, and empowering entrepreneurs.
